item.title: Report E-2023060118
item.description:
Report E-2023060118

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-19
  • City: KENOSHA
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 19, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1791 released approximately one-half (0.5) cup of product due to not being properly secured for transport. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enviroserve (ES) to remediate the site. ES personnel deployed neutralizing agent to the release, then deployed absorbents. The crew utilized hand tools to collect all UN1791 impacted material into one (1) drum liner for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023050010
item.description:
Report E-2023050010

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-13T06:11:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-12
  • City: WAUSAU
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABC SUPPLY CO., INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On April 12, 2023, at 1700 ET, ABC Supply Co., Inc. reported a 6.5-gallon release of UN113 (Mule Hide Bonding Adhesive) from (2) 5-gallon steel pails due to falling off the back of the truck caused by high winds. On April 12, 2023, at 2145 ET, Rock Leaf Water Environmental (RLW) was dispatched to the site to perform clean-up activities. Upon arrival, RLW estimated 6.5-gallons of product released impacting a 10-feet (ft.) by 10-ft. area of asphalt and stagnant water. The product in the puddle was skimmed using a drum vac. Absorbent pads and boom were used to skim the area. Granular absorbents were swept into the area. RLW collected and containerized (2) 5-gallon steel containers of product, granular (oil-dri), boom and pad absorbents, and PPE (gloves) into (1) 55- gallon steel drum.

  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was attempting to deliver gasoline into the customer's storage tank. The driver failed to connect the vapor recovery hose to the storage tank. The local fire department and Clean Harbors Environmental were on site and handled the remediation.

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-21
  • City: MILWAUKEE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL BULK CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver noted that before he started unloading he noticed drips coming from under compartment 1 (ac-55-5 red). It was where the external valve bolts to the discharge piping. it was one drop per minute without pressure on it. He got a bucket underneath. I gave him the ok to proceed with the unload using light air pressure and and as long as it seemed to stay controlled and going in to his bucket. He was able to get it unloaded but called me back at the end and advised that a second leak on the same discharge pipe developed during the unload. 8 drops hit the ground before he noticed that one. It was the opposite end of the same section of pipe where there is another 8 bolt flange assembly, close to where the internal valve bolts to the barrel. Trailer was placed out of service.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: E-track strap holding drum to side of truck wall failed. When the truck entered the destination parking lot, the drum tipped over in the truck and started leaking from the bung. The drum was righted in the truck after approximately 20 minutes. At first it was thought that there was a complete release of product from the drum, but upon righting of drum it was realized that approximately 15 gallons were released. The bung was found to be loose and was tightened. Chemical spill pads were used to corral the spill until remediation the next day. Clean-up consisted of a chemical response company coming out and using oil dry to pick up spill and take away to dispose of.

  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal XTM called in to report a 5-ounce spill of UN1993 "HYDRITE BLEND 4546" from a 55-gallon metal drum caused by improper loading and impacting their trailer floor. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-ounces of product released to a 1' x 1' area of the trailer floor due to a damaged seam caused by improper loading. Absorbents were worked into the impacted area and collected along with the damaged drum of product into a 95-gallon pol overpack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: A Veolia employee was loading drums onto an outbound trailer at Veolia's 10 day intransit facility in Menomonee Falls, WI. The pallet he was moving onto the trailer was shorter than the length of the forks on the forklift. This allowed the tip of the forks to reach past the pallet. As he was loading the pallet, he punctured a drum as he was setting down the pallet. He did not realize that he had punctured a drum until bringing another pallet onto the trailer. Approx. 20 gallons had spilled.

  • City: RICHFIELD
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 17, 2022, Enviroserve was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel investigated and located one (1) leaking 25-liter jerrican inside a crate that released three (3) ounces of material. Enviroserve personnel determined that the jerrican had a bad seal that resulted in the material being released. The contractor neutralized the impacted area and undamaged jerricans in the crate. Two jerricans was placed into two (2) 55-gallon poly drum and the other twelve (12) undamaged containers were placed into three (3) 55-gallon poly drums. One additional 55-gallon poly drum was generated containing the contractors personal protective equipment (PPE). Two (2) super sacks were generated containing the non-impacted crate and Styrofoam. The three (3) 55-gallons poly drums will be sent on to its destination. The generated waste containers were transported offsite by Enviroserve personnel to process for disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: AT 1110 ET, XPO logistics terminal XTM called to report a plastic tote with a metal cage filled with Liquid 422 - UN1824 Sodium Hydroxide Solution , that has a small puncture on its side that releases when moved. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-ounces of product released to the dock floor in a 1' x 1' area due to a pinhole puncture caused by the tote's metal cage. Contractors transferred the material into a new tote. The damaged tote, impacted absorbent rags and cleanup debris were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2022120286
item.description:
Report E-2022120286

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-12T21:09:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-09
  • City: Milwaukee
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL BULK CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The delivery site originally wanted us to leave with the product as they had enough in their tank. We worked with the shipper who authorized us to do a partial delivery. The driver was not familiar with the process of doing a partial delivery. When the receiver told her to stop the tank was completely full instead of leaving 10% headspace like we requested. This means she could not use her airline to blow the lines clear through what we call the bleeder valve system. She now had to do a 'wet break' which she was unfamiliar with and did not stop and call one of our safety representatives for guidance. She opened the bleeder valve and let product drain off until it stopped. However she never walked the hoses to the bleeder valve to drain off additional product. We recommend draining off 5 gallons in to buckets to ensure there is sufficient headspace in the hose when disconnecting from the highest point first. Since this was not done when the hose was disconnected product rushed out the end of the delivery hose and overshot her spill bucket and on to the ground. After she capped off that hose end she went to disconnect from the customer fill line and again a little product splashed out again.

The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: At 0918 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XML. It was reported that approximately 2 quarts of Super Power Foam Cl were released from a 265-gallon poly tote due to a loose cap. The release impacted the inside ceiling and walls of trailer #3117578. ERTS dispatched EnviroServe to conduct cleanup. At 1210 ET, EnviroServe personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2 ounces of product released to a 4' x 4' area if the trailer wall. The tote cap was re-secured onto the tote and a slosh test conducted to ensure no more release of product would occur in transit. All released product was collected with oil-dri and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
